item.title: Serendip-o-matic
item.description: As their page states: “Serendip-o-matic connects your sources to digital materials located in libraries, museums, and archives around the world. By first examining your research interests, and then identifying related content in locations such as the Digital Public Library of America (DPLA), Europeana, and Flickr Commons, our serendipity engine helps you discover photographs, documents, maps and other primary sources.

item.title: Kringla
item.description: The online portal of the Swedish National Heritage Board (SOCH) www.kringla.nu allows users to search in both the national heritage repository ‘SOCH’ and the Europeana repository presenting the search results in different tabs.

item.title: Culture Collage
item.description: Culture Collage is developed by Monique Szpak (@zenlan) and started as a simple exercise in mashing up a few web technologies, including those of Europeana API.

item.title: Biblioteca Digital Hispánica
item.description: The National Library of Spain has implemented the Europeana API in their online portal, Biblioteca Digital Hispánica. The portal now enables their users to access related Europeana content via a single link on their search results header.

item.title: UK Heritage + Culture Open Data Challenge
item.description: ["Nesta and the Open Data Institute are asking teams to develop products and services which answer the question: 'How can we use open data to engage more people, and more diverse people, in UK heritage and culture?'"]

item.title: Future Everything Festival, February 2015, Manchester
item.description: ["2015 will welcome the 20th edition of the Future Everything Festival. Artists, designers, city makers, activists, technologists and business people will get together in Manchester’s stunning Town Hall to discover, share and experience new ideas about the future."]

item.title: Europeana Tech Conference, 2015
item.description: ["This event will bring together application developers, information professionals, technology researchers and decision makers in the cultural domain."]

item.title: Europeana Creative Design Challenge
item.description: ["Europeana Creative is pleased to announce its final challenge encouraging you to design and submit products, applications and designs that reuse Europeana content in the theme of Design."]

item.title: Europeana Food & Drink challenge
item.description: ["Our partner project Apps4Europe invites developers, start-ups and companies that use open data to join the project’s online competition and win a spot at the International Business Lounge @ Future Everything conference on 26 and 27 February 2015 in Manchester (UK)."]

item.title: Apps for Europe Competition
item.description: ["Our partner project Apps4Europe invites developers, start-ups and companies that use open data to join the project’s online competition and win a spot at the International Business Lounge @ Future Everything conference on 26 and 27 February 2015 in Manchester (UK)."]

item.title: Who's Using What - Joe Germuska Developer Profile
item.description: In this new series “Who’s using what?”, EuropeanaTech Community Manager Gregory Markus from the Netherlands Institute for Sound and Vision, will be profiling the use of open source software within the EuropeanaTech Communty and the greater digital cultural heritage world at large. Softwares will range from storytelling tools that enable reuse to OCRs or libraries and everything inbetween. Enjoy!

item.title: Europeana Creative Design Challenge now open
item.description: Europeana Creative is pleased to announce its final challenge encouraging you to design and submit products, applications and designs that reuse Europeana content in the theme of Design.

item.title: Open source tools - what's available, what are you using?
item.description: By Gregory Markus, Netherlands Institute for Sound and Vision

item.title: Redesign your cultural heritage at Mozilla Festival 2014
item.description: ["The aim of the Redesign Your Cultural Heritage! session at MozFest2014 aims to connect the digital cultural heritage offered by Europeana to communities of designers and artists who wish to use open cultural content - data, pictures, sound, videos - as inspiration and sources for new derivative works, such as animations and films, media art and installations, textile patterns, and other design artefacts."]

item.title: Hunting for First World War data - CENDARI and the Europeana API
item.description: By Valentine Charles (EuropeanaFoundation) and Milica Knezevic (Mathematical Institute SANU)

item.title: Objects of Swedish daily life from the 18th century until now
Black-and-white ethnographic photographs from the Swedish Museum of Ethnography
Culture Grid
item.description: Culture Grid opens up a wealth of information from museums, galleries, libraries and archives: giving greater access to UK culture, arts and heritage. It is also an aggregator, powering UK collections into Europeana. On their own search portal they have used the Europeana API to offer users extended search results from across Europe.

item.title: Hack4Pisa
item.description: ["A two day hackathon and business lounge organised in cooperation with Hyperborea s.r.l and Polo Tecnologico di Navacchio."]

item.title: 2nd Europeana Creative Challenge Award Ceremony
item.description: ["This event is hosted in collaboration with Apps&Culture and formally closes the second challenge on tourism and social networks themes."]

item.title: Digital Storytelling Prototype
item.description: The Digital Storytelling Prototype was developed by partners Netherlands Institute of Sound and Vision, National Technical University Athens, Spild af Tid and Europeana and is an outcome of the Europeana Awareness project. It’s a service (backend, API and client) that allows users to create and publish collections of content, mixing their own uploads with existing content in Europeana and on YouTube. As the code is open, anyone can use it to build their own storytelling platforms.

item.title: User contributed content from Poland, relating to the events of 1989 in Central and Eastern Europe.
User contributed content from Lithuania, relating to the events of 1989 in Central and Eastern Europe.
User contributed content from Latvia, relating to the events of 1989 in Central and Eastern Europe.
User contributed content from Estonia, relating to the events of 1989 in Central and Eastern Europe.
Slovakian collection of paintings and sculptures
Paintings of Dutch landscapes and local views
Newsreels from Sound and Vision on the Netherlands in the 20th century
Lithographic prints from Bibliothèque Municipale de Lyon
Haunting sketches and other pieces of art from Bulgaria
Estonian cultural heritage provided by Athena
Drawings and sketches from the National Library of Wales
Black and white photographs from Lithuania
Biblical narratives in art from Bibliothèque Municipale de Lyon
A wide variety of cultural heritage objects from the Rotterdam Museum
3D models of Art Nouveau objects from the Isle of Man
New translation method in the Europeana API
item.description: We have recently released a new translation method in the Europeana API.

item.title: Europeana Labs update; take a Creative Challenge
item.description: Welcome to the 2nd Europeana Labs newsletter. Every few months we bring you the latest news from Europeana, focussed on showcasing the exciting opportunities available to our developer community and inspiring you to be creative with Europe’s cultural heritage!

item.title: Node.js module for the Europeana API
item.description: Unofficial Node.js module for the Europeana API.

item.title: Apps&Cultura workshop: using Europeana content and the Europeana API
item.description: ["Apps&Cultura has teamed up with Europeana Creative for this year’s Hack at Home competition and the second round of the Europeana Creative Challenges. In this workshop the team from Europeana will be demonstrating how to use the Europeana API and include it into your applications."]

item.title: 2nd Europeana Creative Challenge Workshop, Barcelona, 16 July 2014
item.description: This blog post has been created to support the Europeana Creative Challenge workshop, Barcelona, 16 July 2014, held in association with Apps&Cultura. For those not able to attend, the event will be livestreamed at http://xmpp.iglor.es/appscultura_europeanalab/

item.title: Wandora's Europeana Extractor
item.description: Wandora is a general purpose information extraction, management and publishing application based on Topic Maps and Java.

item.title: Rest Easy (Python)
item.description: This Python module dynamically creates wrappers for RESTful APIs from YAML markup. It has a ready-made wrapper for the Europeana API as well as for a number of other GLAM APIs.

item.title: europeana-search-0.2.1 (Python)
item.description: Basic Python wrapper for the Europeana Search API

item.title: Europeana PHP library
item.description: This is a PHP library for the Europeana API. The library is used to power an interactive documentation site for the Europeana API.

item.title: Open Knowledge Festival 2014 - Open Minds to Open Action
item.description: ["The event gathers together open movement makers, thinkers, activists and researchers from around the world. To inspire 'Open Minds to Open Action' (as the slogan goes), the 2014 edition will be a space for learning and dialogue where the activities of the international participants shapes the event and its outcomes."]

item.title: yuma.min.js
item.description: Open Source media annotation toolkit that makes content on a Web page annotatable with just a few lines of JavaScript. Deprectated Cf. ‘Annotorious’

item.title: easyLOD
item.description: Simple framework for exposing Linked Open Data from arbitrary sources.

item.title: dat
item.description: dat is an open source tool that enables the sharing of large datasets, allowing for a decentralized collaboration flow

item.title: XTF
item.description: The eXtensible Text Framework (XTF) is a powerful open source platform for providing access to digital content.

item.title: VuFind
item.description: Library resource portal.

item.title: Video Frame Analyzer
item.description: This application is used to analyze technical properties of individual frames of a video file in order to detect quality issues within digitized video files. Within video files, the quality issues that might arise vary from collection to collection. This application allows the user to configure the tests to be performed against a file and to tailor those setting to a specific collection.

item.title: Tabula
item.description: Tabula is a tool for liberating data tables trapped inside PDF files.

item.title: REPOX
item.description: REPOX is a framework to manage metadata spaces. It comprises several channels to import metadata from data providers, services to transform metadata between schemas according to user’s specified rules, and services to expose the results to the exterior. REPOX aims to provide to all the TEL and Europeana partners a simple solution to import, convert and expose their bibliographic data via OAI-PMH.

item.title: Phraseanet
item.description: Phraseanet is an Open Source Digital Asset Management (DAM) software.

item.title: OpenSeadragon
item.description: An open-source, web-based viewer for zoomable images, implemented in pure JavaScript.

item.title: Neatline
item.description: The Scholars’ Lab designed Neatline as a suite of plugins for the open-source Omeka framework, which provides a powerful platform for content management and web publication. Through Neatline, you can create create rich representations of places, objects, events, narratives, and documents. Demo is available at http://neatline.org/neatline-in-action/

item.title: MediaMosa
item.description: MediaMosa is open source software to build a Full Featured, Webservice Oriented Media Management and Distribution platform.

item.title: MediaInfo
item.description: A convenient unified display of the most relevant technical and tag data for video and audio files.

item.title: MINT
item.description: MINT services compose a web based platform that was designed and developed to facilitate aggregation initiatives for cultural heritage content and metadata in Europe.

item.title: MAchine Readable Cataloging (MARC)
item.description: MARC is a ruby library for reading and writing MAchine Readable Cataloging (MARC)

item.title: Leaflet
item.description: Leaflet is an open source JavaScript library for mobile-friendly interactive maps

item.title: IIPMooViewer
item.description: IIPMooViewer is a high performance light-weight HTML5 Ajax-based javascript image streaming and zooming client designed for the IIPImage high resolution imaging system. Demo is available at http://iipimage.sourceforge.net/demo/

item.title: IIPImage
item.description: IIPImage is an advanced high-performance feature-rich image server system for web-based streamed viewing and zooming of ultra high-resolution images.

item.title: Internet Archive BookReader
item.description: The Internet Archive BookReader is used to view books from the Internet Archive online and can also be used to view other books Demo is available at http://www.archive.org/stream/birdbookillustra00reedrich#page/n3/mode/2up

item.title: GathrIt
item.description: The concept of GathrIt is to provide a crowdsourcing toolset for cultural collections. Demo is available at http://collection.catchingtherain.com/items/show/58

item.title: Evergreen
item.description: Evergreen is a highly-scalable software for libraries that helps library patrons find library materials, and helps libraries manage, catalog, and circulate those materials, no matter how large or complex the libraries.

item.title: Echoprint
item.description: Internet design and authoring tools.

item.title: Doc Viewer
item.description: HTML5 document viewer

item.title: Docsplit
item.description: Docsplit is a command-line utility and Ruby library for splitting apart documents into their component parts: searchable UTF-8 plain text, page images or thumbnails in any format, PDFs, single pages, and document metadata (title, author, number of pages…)

item.title: Data Pipes
item.description: Data Pipes is a service to provide streaming, “pipe-like” data transformations on the web – things like deleting rows or columns, find and replace, head, grep etc.

item.title: DSpace
item.description: DSpace open source software is a turnkey repository application Demo available at http://demo.dspace.org/

item.title: DBpedia Spotlight
item.description: DBpedia Spotlight is a tool for automatically annotating mentions of DBpedia resources in text, providing a solution for linking unstructured information sources to the Linked Open Data cloud through DBpedia.

item.title: DAITSS
item.description: DAITSS is a digital preservation software application.

item.title: D3-cartogram
item.description: Continuous area cartograms with d3 and TopoJSON

item.title: CollectionSpace
item.description: CollectionSpace is an open-source collections management application that meets the needs of museums, historical societies, and other collection-holding organizations. CollectionSpace is designed to be configurable to each organization’s needs, serving as a gateway to digital and physical assets across an institution. The software is freely distributed via open-source licensing, and an active developer community ensures that CollectionSpace is continually improving. Demo is available at www.demo.collectionspace.org

item.title: Catmandu
item.description: Catmandu provides a suite of Perl modules to ease the import, storage, retrieval, export and transformation of metadata records.

item.title: CKAN
item.description: CKAN is an open-source DMS (data management system) for powering data hubs and data portals. CKAN makes it easy to publish, share and use data. Demo is available at http://ckan.org/case-studies/

item.title: CHContext
item.description: CHContext is a JavaScript-based widget that is able to provide a list of links to cultural heritage materials based on predefined item of a website on which it is embedded (via given JQuery HTML selector).

item.title: BibServer
item.description: BibServer is a tool for quickly and easily sharing collections of bibliographic metadata. By making it simple for people to use this information, we make scholarship better.

item.title: ArchivesSpace
item.description: A next-generation archives management application that will incorporate the best features of Archivist’s Toolkit (AT) and Archon. The project team is developing a technical platform, governance structure, and service model that will provide the archival community with a cutting-edge, extensible, and sustainable platform for describing analog and born-digital archival materials. The ArchivesSpace product is being developed using an Agile scrum process, guided by a Product Vision for ArchivesSpace.

item.title: Archivematica
item.description: Archivematica is a free and open-source digital preservation system that is designed to maintain standards-based, long-term access to collections of digital objects. Demo is available at sankofa.archivematica.org/administration/accounts/login/ (user name: demo@example.com, password: demo)

item.title: Apache PDFBox
item.description: The Apache PDFBox™ library is an open source Java tool for working with PDF documents. This project allows creation of new PDF documents, manipulation of existing documents and the ability to extract content from documents.

item.title: Annotator
item.description: The Annotator is an open-source JavaScript library and tool that can be added to any webpage to make it annotatable. Demo is available at http://okfnlabs.org/annotator/demo/

item.title: Europeana Ruby Client Library
item.description: Ruby client library for the search and retrieval of records from the Europeana REST API. The gem is developed as part of Europeana 1914-1918 and is also used in that application.

item.title: Waisda?
item.description: Waisda? - A prototype Dutch-language game site which explores the social tagging of video in the cultural heritage domain.

item.title: Timeline JS
item.description: TimelineJS is an open-source tool that enables you to build visually-rich interactive timelines and is available in 40 languages.

item.title: Omeka
item.description: A Collection/Exhibition Management System

item.title: Mirador
item.description: An open-source, web-based ‘multi-up’ viewer that supports zoom-pan-rotate functionality, ability to display/compare simple images, and images with annotations Demo is available at [http://iiif.io/mirador/demo/] (http://iiif.io/mirador/demo/)

item.title: Blacklight
item.description: RoR gem discovery interface for any Solr index. Demo is available at [https://github.com/projectblacklight/blacklight/wiki/Examples] (https://github.com/projectblacklight/blacklight/wiki/Examples)

item.title: Apache Tika
item.description: The Apache Tika toolkit detects and extracts metadata and structured text content from various documents using existing parser libraries.

item.title: Annotorious
item.description: Annotorious is a JavaScript annotation library for images and zoomable images. Link the Annotorious source files (CSS and JavaScript) into an existing HTML page, and images inside this page will be enhanced with an interactive drawing and commenting tool.

item.title: The Europas - The European Tech Startup Awards
item.description: ["Founded in 2009, The Europas are the premier awards for Europe’s most forward thinking, progressive and innovative tech companies across over some 20+ categories."]

item.title: Europeana Open Culture
item.description: The Europeana Open Culture app lets users explore hand-picked and beautiful image collections from some of Europe’s top cultural institutions. They can browse, share and download for free more than 350,000 high-resolution images from four themes: Maps and Plans, Images of the Past, Treasures of Art and Treasures of Nature.

item.title: WWI collection of the Berlin State Library
Works of art from the Rijksmuseum
Scans of plants from the OpenUp! project
Scans of plants from the OpenUp! project
Scans of plants from the OpenUp! project
Scans of plants and more natural history objects from the OpenUp! project
Paintings from Rybinsk State Architectural, Historical and Art Museum
Natural history objects from the OpenUp! project
Historic events in paintings from the Amsterdam Museum
WWI books from the British Library
Wikimedia Batch Upload
item.description:
This prototype makes it possible to upload content to Wikimedia Commons from Europeana.

NOTE: The prototype has now been superceeded by the GLAMwiki toolset.

1st Hackathon 2011

item.title: Wikiana
item.description: The Wikiana prototype (redeveloped as Storyana at a later hackathon) combines Wikipedia with the data available in Europeana.

item.title: Wandora's Europeana Extractor
item.description: Wandora is a general purpose information extraction, management and publishing application based on Topic Maps and Java.

item.title: VuFind Europeana search results recommendation module
item.description: VuFind is an Open Source discovery interface for digital libraries used by a large number of institutions.

item.title: Visual Chronology
item.description: Visual Chronology is a sketch displaying Europeana search results on a timeline. At the bottom of the screen, years are represented by dots.

item.title: Twitter EuropeanaBot
item.description: Inspired by the DPLABot, this implementation uses Europeana API to present semi-random images from Europeana collections on Twitter.

item.title: TimeMash
item.description: TimeMash is a search client for historical data from Europeana.

item.title: Timebook
item.description: Timebook is an aggregator of information coming from DBPedia, Wikiquote and Europeana about personalities of the past (in particular composers, painters, writers or artists in general). It formats the information in the form of a Facebook-like profile, creating a social network of artists by looking at the influences in each other’s works.

item.title: The Culture Center (TCC)
item.description: The prototype was developed using the Europeana API and YQL (Yahoo Query language) to build a quick and powerful culture information search tool.

item.title: Storyscope
item.description: The software includes an attractive visual interface that allows users to not only collect and arrange online objects, but to shape these collections into compelling narratives.

item.title: Storyana
item.description: Winner in the category ‘Most innovative app.’ at Hack4Europe ‘12 - Belgium. Storyana is a novel interface for exploring Europeana’s vast and interesting collections through short stories.

item.title: Stackathon
item.description: Winner in the category ‘Greatest commercial potential’ at Hack4Europe ‘12 - Belgium. Finalist at the Digital Agenda Assembly, June 2012, Brussels.

item.title: Sounds of daily life and birds from Netherlands Institute of Sound and Vision
Share What You See
item.description: Share What you See supports easy blogging of Europeana content via Word Press. Winner in the category ‘Audience award´ at Hack4Europe ‘11 - UK.

item.title: Royal Museum for Central Africa search
item.description: The Royal Museum for Central Africa in Belgium is one of Europeana’s content providers. On their Plone powered website, they have made their contributed content searchable using the Europeana API.

item.title: Related items widget
item.description: The PIONIER Network Digital Libraries Federation have a related items widget that uses the Google Translate API to translate keywords to other languages before sending them to the Europeana API.

item.title: Random Images Explorer
item.description: Semantic enrichment game. 1st Hackathon 2011.

item.title: ProgrammeNotes
item.description: The team built a simple HTML5 player displaying interactive historical information related to a musical work while the track plays through SoundCloud.

item.title: Postcards from Baltics
item.description: Winner in the category ‘Greatest commercial potential’ at Hack4Europe ‘12 - Latvia.

item.title: Portraits and some shoes from Europeana Fashion
Portal Thingy
item.description: Winner in the category ‘Developers’ Pick’ at Hack4Europe ‘12 - Belgium. The Portal Thingy is a prototype search portal which offers users the chance to enrich Europeana metadata.

item.title: PIONIER Network Digital Libraries Federation (Federacja Bibliotek Cyfrowych) - Europeana search (API)
item.description: Related content from Europeana is shown under the PIONIER Network Digital Libraries Federation search results. As they are a Europeana aggregator, their own objects in Europeana are filtered out of the API responses in order to avoid duplicate hits.

item.title: Pictures and scientific texts of birds from Naturalis
Open Pics app
item.description: This open source app allows search for images in multiple online collections.

item.title: National Library of New Zealand
item.description: The digital service of the National Library of New Zealand - Digital New Zealand (DigitalNZ) - uses the Europeana API (1.0) to harvest and locally store New Zealand-related Europeana records in their own aggregation.

item.title: National Library of Ireland catalogue widget
item.description: This interface allows simultaneous search of many of the Library’s catalogued collections, including digitised material.

item.title: myHometo.wn
item.description: myHometo.wn can be likened to a public genealogy for all cities across a country.

item.title: MuseumVille
item.description: This prototype has been inspired by the addictive Facebook game Farmville.

item.title: Jeremy Ottevanger’s mashificator, Imperial War Museum
item.description: It uses semantic extraction (through two commercial APIs - Zemanta and Yahoo) to create keywords representing places, people, subjects and periods. It then queries a number of different museum APIs and displays the results as an image slide.

item.title: Institution Recommendations Based on Geospatial Data
item.description: Winner in the category ‘Greatest Commercial Potential’ and the category ‘Developers’ Pick’ (together with ‘Art Seeker’) at Hack4Europe ‘11 - Poland. The prototype is a mobile web application which recommends Europeana content providers near to a user’s location (based on his/her current GPS coordinates) and shows their content on Europeana.

item.title: Image Form Query Suggestions
item.description: Building on an analysis of user behaviour ,this prototype gives users suggestions related to their intitial search query.

item.title: History4u
item.description: History4u is a mobile application for Windows 7 which allows the search and display of historical photographs available on Europeana.The application uses GPS technology to identify the nearest place based on the user’s current coordinates and presents old pictures of this location.

item.title: Hackmemory
item.description: A simple educational application for kids and adults based on well-known memory games.

item.title: Gamepad 2.0
item.description: Winner in the category ‘General Public‘ at Hack4LT. Gamepad 2.0 is an interactive multiplayer HTML5 game.

item.title: Europeana4Education (E4E)
item.description: E4E is a set of two widgets that automatically suggest cultural resources from Europeana and learning resources from Open Discovery Space. It is aimed at authors of educational pathways. E4E widgets can be integrated into an authoring environment such as OMEKA to augment the authoring process and to enhance the educational impact of a pathway. The main rationale behind E4E development was to explore the educational uses of items on Europeana. The E4E widgets were developed in the context of the Natural Europe and Open Discovery Space projects. Winner in the category ‘Social Inclusion’ at Hack4Europe ‘12 - Belgium.

item.title: Europeana Portfolio
item.description: The prototype is based on a combination of SCAM framework (EntryStore) and Confolio (EntryScape) and allows the creation of online learning resources using Europeana metadata.

item.title: Europeana on Free Image Search Tool
item.description: The prototype is a further development of the Free Image Search Tool (FIST), a tool to help illustrate articles on Wikipedia.

item.title: Europeana Layar
item.description: The prototype allows the user to view Europeana geo-enabled items in an augmented reality mode on Layar compatible devices.

item.title: Europeana Geo Search
item.description: Europeana Geo Search app for Android: http://pro.europeana.eu/c/document_library/get_file?uuid=2ab26ca0-a4e7-4ea7-87fb-a2828fe2e2eb&groupId=462475

item.title: Europeana Field Game
item.description: Winner in the category ‘Most innovative app’ at Hack4Europe ‘11 - Poland.

item.title: Europeana Fancy Search
item.description: Fancy Search is a Europeana Search API component prototype for Joomla 1.6.

item.title: Europeana Banana
item.description: Semantic enrichment game developed at Europeana’s 1st Hackathon in 2011

item.title: Europ.in: Pinboard-style picture search engine
item.description: Europ.in allows for very visual search and browsing of Europeana content.

item.title: eu:KindleSearch
item.description: euKindleSearch easily produces e-books for the Amazon Kindle based on searches in the Europeana collections. Winner in the category ‘Greatest Commercial Potential’ at Hack4Europe ‘11 - UK.

item.title: EOD search
item.description: Over 6000 books have been digitised via EOD. Through the Europeana API, EOD search results are enriched with relevant Europeana records.

item.title: Django Europeana 0.1.5
item.description: This is a client library for Django, the free and open source web framework written in Python.

item.title: DISMARC
item.description: DISMARC aggregates music from archives all across Europe and makes it available in their own portal and in Europeana. Through our API, searches in their portal also return results from Europeana.

item.title: Cultured Canvas
item.description: Winner in the category ‘Most innovative app’ at Hack4Europe ‘11 - UK Cultured Canvas is an easy way to promote culture to a user’s Twitter followers.

item.title: Culture Globe
item.description:
eTech Hackathon 2011 winner Culture Globe allows users to navigate through Europeana content on an interactive globe and timeline.

It accomplishes this by using cutting-edge HTML5 and WebGL technology in combination with semantic information from Europeana and Freebase.

item.title: Crowdhwr
item.description: Winner in the category ‘Digital Humanities‘ at Hack4LT. Crowdhwr is a crowdsourcing manuscripts’ transcription system for digital humanities.

item.title: Content collected during the Europeana 1914-1918 roadshows
Casual Curator
item.description: Winner in the category ‘Social Inclusion’ at Hack4Europe ‘11 - UK. Finalist at the Digital Agenda Assembly, June 2011, Brussels.

item.title: Butterflies, minerals and drawings from the Museum of Natural History in Berlin
ArtSpace
item.description: ArtSpace promotes access to art in everyday situations i.e. Europeana collections can be made available in public places such as coffee shops, libraries, schools and hotels.

item.title: Art4Europe
item.description: Winner in the category ‘Greatest commercial potential’ at Hack4Europe ‘11 - Poland. Finalist at the Digital Agenda Assembly, June 2011, Brussels

item.title: Art Terra
item.description: Winner in the category ‘Social inclusion’ at Hack4Europe ‘11 - Poland.

item.title: Art Seeker
item.description: The prototype is a mobile application for art discovery.

item.title: Art Color Bits
item.description: Art Color Bits introduces an innovative way of browsing painters’ works by colours.

item.title: Art and life on postcards and photographs from Girona
Archaeological Artefacts from the Institute of Balkan Studies and Thracology
Focus on re-usable datasets
item.description: In April we added over 1 million new items to Europeana. The majority of these new collections are openly licensed and re-usable.

item.title: First Europeana Creative Challenge Award Ceremony
item.description: ["The event formally closes the first challenge on history education and natural history education themes."]

item.title: Coding Da Vinci
item.description: ["Coding Da Vinci is organised by the German Digital Library, Digital Service Center Berlin, Open Knowledge Foundation Germany and Wikimedia Germany. It brings together developers, web and game designers and representatives of cultural institutions to explore ideas for re-use of cultural content."]

item.title: Can I use it?
item.description: Uncovering the technology behind the simple search tool to discover reusable content available in both the Europeana portal and API.

item.title: vieu- europeana cultural heritage visual search
item.description: vieu- europeana cultural heritage visual search - vieu is a visual search engine focusing on cultural heritage content. Starting from a random set of query suggestions, the user can get a list of matching images ranked by visual similarity. These results are retrieved from a collection of images from Europeana data providers. Along with the results, the user is presented with a direct link to the image page in the Europeana portal.

item.title: PATHS- Personalised Access to Cultural Heritage Spaces
item.description: PATHS- Personalised Access to Cultural Heritage Spaces The latest prototype of the  PATHS system offers users a collection discovery environment which personalises their access and use of very large digital libraries.  The prototype demonstrates search and visualisation techniques based on enriched metadata.  For users it offers narrative pathways which can be followed step by step, while allowing them to leave at any time by following recommendations and links to related items and contextual resources.  Users who are logged in to the system can search and browse the collections using these tools and can save interesting items to their workspace for use in creating, publishing and sharing their pathways.

item.title: ECLAP Linked Open Graph
item.description: ECLAP Linked Open Graph –The Linked Open Graph has been developed by the project ECLAP, the e-library for performing arts. ECLAP provides Europeana with a variety of performing-arts resources such as videos of dance rehearsals, dance, theatre performances, animations, playlists. The Linked Open Graph allows users to see, explore and browse the relationships among the ECLAP content and other types of resource created on the ECLAP platform.

item.title: ASSETS 3D search
item.description: ASSETS 3D search - The ASSETS 3D search demo allows users to search for 3D models that are similar to a returned search query. In this demonstrator, users can search among 300 3D models from the Google 3D Warehouse using one model as a template for finding other models similar to it. This is made possible by analysing and indexing the shape of each 3D model and using the index as a basis for search.

item.title: Coding Da Vinci competition award ceremony
item.description: ["The ceremony is preceded by a get together BBQ for all participants. On Day 2 the hackathon finalists will present their project and win cool prizes."]

item.title: 2nd Europeana Creative Challenge on Tourism and Social Networks (online)
item.description: ["App developers, e-book publishers, web and game designers will be invited to submit their ideas for the re-use of cultural content in tourism and social network applications."]

item.title: Stanbol
item.description: Stanbol- The Apache Stanbol project was initiated by the European R&D project IKS (Interactive Knowledge Stack).

item.title: Search Engine For Europeana
item.description: Search Engine For Europeana - A search engine that links data together to enable improved search.

item.title: Pundit
item.description: Pundit – Pundit is an open source semantic annotation tool developed by Net7 allowing users to create structured data annotating the web. Pundit not only enables users to annotate Web pages in various ways (comments, citations, boo kmarks…) but also to convert these annotations into semantically structured data that can be later integrated to the “Semantic Web”.

item.title: PATHSenrich
item.description: PATHSenrich – A web service prototype developed by PATHS project allowing independent content providers to enrich their cultural heritage at item level. The aim of PATHS project is to enable exploration and discovery within cultural heritage collections. In order to support this, the project developed a range of enrichment techniques which augmented these collections with additional information to enhance users’s browsing experience. The semantic enrichment techniques developed in PATHS are summarised in this document, which details how these techniques are applied to the Europeana data. The demonstration system developed for PATHS that uses the content from Europeana is available here.

item.title: MyStoryPlayer
item.description: MyStoryPlayer - MyStoryPlayer is an audiovisual annotation tool developed by the projectECLAP, the e-library for performing arts.

item.title: MIMO-DB: MIMO Aggregator BackOffice
item.description: MIMO-DB: MIMO Aggregator BackOffice - The MIMO-DB was developed as part of the MIMO Project (Musical Instrument Museums Online). This service is used by all partners to monitor the harvesting and enrichment of their metadata. It allows for multilingual search. The MIMO-DB is a professional front-end to an XML database using the new LIDO museum metadata model.

item.title: EuropeanaConnect Gazetteer
item.description: EuropeanaConnect Gazetteer - A rich data resource including over 9m geographic names, co-ordinates, and boundaries.

item.title: EuropeanaConnect Geoparser
item.description: Disclaimer: The Goeparser is currently down. The service should be re-started in the coming months.

item.title: Europeana 4D
item.description: Europeana 4D

item.title: ASSETS image search
item.description: ASSETS image search - The ASSETS image search demo presents a technology that searches for similar images.

item.title: Welcome to the new Europeana Labs
item.description: This new Europeana Labs website is intended to provide all you need to get started using the Europeana APIs. Learn about the data, see what others have created, and find out how to build simple but powerful queries to extract bespoke results from a dataset of over 30 million objects - books, photos of art and artefacts, audio clips and more.

item.title: International Business Lounge, Future Everything Conference
item.description: ["The International Business Lounge is the culmination of the first year of Apps for Europe. From the various Business Lounge events that have taken place and an open call for participants, ten winners have been chosen to present their work at FutureEverything."]

item.title: VAMP Metadata validation
item.description: VAMP Metadata validation - Semantic validation of MPEG-7 documents.

item.title: SIWA
item.description: SIWA: The EuropeanaConnect Service Integration Platform - A framework to apply external services to objects in Europeana, enabling mash-ups.

item.title: Presto Prime- mapping tool
item.description: Metadata mapping - The mapping and validation of metadata formats for audiovisual content, and visualisation of mappings.

item.title: MIMO-VOC - A multilingual vocabulary management tool
item.description: MIMO-VOC: A multilingual vocabulary management tool - This tool was developed as part of the MIMO Project(Musical Instrument Museums Online).

item.title: Europeana Linked Open Data feeds Irish place name database
item.description: Europeana Linked Open Data feeds Irish place name database

item.title: Karma
item.description: Karma mapping tool - Karma proposes a semantic approach to data mapping. It is a mapping tool that can be used to map data in a variety of formats and from a variety of data sources (databases, spreadsheets, XML…) to structured RDF. It also allows the creation of links to external resources such as DBpedia or GeoNames.

item.title: Global References Indexto Biodiversity (GRIB)
item.description: Global References Index to Biodiversity (GRIB) - A collection of bibliographic data from the natural history museums and botanical gardens of Europe and the USA.

item.title: Europeana Connect Annotation Suite
item.description: Disclaimer The EuropeanaConnect Annotation Suite is now a stable tool renamed as Annotorious. For more details see the [Annotorious entry] (http://labs.europeana.eu/apps/Annotorious-FLOSS/)

item.title: EFG metadata editor
item.description: EFG Metadata Editor - A tool to add, edit and delete records from a federated repository. The European Film Gateway Metadata Editor allows the editing, addition or deletion of metadata records in the federated EFG repository.

item.title: EFG Authority File Manager
item.description: EFG Authority File Manager- A tool to create unique records for people, organisations and film works.

item.title: BHL Scan List
item.description: BHL Scan List - A tool to co-ordinate scanning efforts across biodiversity heritage organisations.

item.title: Amsterdam Museum Linked Open Data
item.description: Amsterdam Museum Linked Open Data- The Linked Open Data Cloud connects items from various domains, including cultural heritage. By using unique web-identifiers (URIs) for objects and a common framework for describing them (RDF), and by linking to existing resources, a web of semantically-linked data emerges.

item.title: Inventing Europe
item.description: The Inventing Europe online platform is a pioneering collaboration between historians and cultural heritage institutions across Europe.

item.title: Hispana
item.description: HISPANA aggregates content from Spanish libraries, archives and museums.

item.title: europeana4j (Java client library)
item.description: europeana4j is a Java library which allows applications to search and retrieve Europeana data, including millions of books, paintings, films, museum objects and archival records that have been digitised throughout Europe.

item.title: Europeana Search Python
item.description: Europeana Search Python is a basic Python wrapper using Europeana API 2.0 which allows applications to search and retrieve Europeana data, including millions of books, paintings, films, museum objects and archival records that have been digitised throughout Europe.

item.title: Europeana Remix
item.description: Europeana Remix is an interactive platform based on the film ‘Otto & Bernard’. This short film was produced for the project Europeana 1914-1918, encouraging families to share photos, letters and memorabilia of World War I. Now, the film forms the basis of the Remix initiative, combining cutting-edge technology (Popcorn.js, the HTML5 video framework) and a variety of resources from Europeana (via the API) and across the web.

item.title: Europeana Local Austria
item.description: The Europeana Local Austria portal aggregates content from regional and local Austrian libraries, archives and museums. Through our API, searches in their portal also return results from Europeana.

item.title: Europeana eCloud
item.description: The project provides a unique visual experience, featuring personal World War One stories collected across Europe as part of Europeana’s 1914-18 Family History Roadshows.

item.title: The ECLAP e-library of performing arts
item.description: The ECLAP e-library of performing arts is a Europeana group project member and content provider. On their Drupal powered website, any search will display results from Europeana in a sidebar widget.

item.title: Dutch Museum of Natural History
item.description: The Dutch Museum of National History presents the history of Dutch people in images and stories. Should a user search for a historical person, the result pages include also Europeana content related to this individual.

item.title: ATHENA
item.description: ATHENA is a project developing metadata exchange standards for the museum domain and aggregating museum content for Europeana. Through our API, they have built a search service where users can perform keyword searches and structured searches to find and view Europeana items.

item.title: Europeana4Education (E4E)
item.description: E4E is a set of two widgets that automatically suggest cultural resources from Europeana and learning resources from Open Discovery Space. It is aimed at authors of educational pathways. E4E widgets can be integrated into an authoring environment such as OMEKA to augment the authoring process and to enhance the educational impact of a pathway. The main rationale behind E4E development was to explore the educational uses of items on Europeana. The E4E widgets were developed in the context of the Natural Europe and Open Discovery Space projects. Winner in the category ‘Social Inclusion’.

item.title: i-Matériel.Lab | Paris
item.description: i-Matériel.Lab is the user driven innovation platform dedicated to Cultural Heritage and Tourism, specialized in mobile products and services (Smartphones, touch screen Tablets and Smart Objects).

item.title: AALTO Fab Lab | Helsinki
item.description: FabLab (fabrication laboratory) is a small-scale workshop for digital fabrication, started by MIT. In a Fablab you can find machines such as the lasercutter, vinyl cutter, desktop CNC milling machine and 3D printer and electronics prototyping equipment.

item.title: Future Classroom Lab | Brussels
item.description: The Future Classroom Lab in Brussels is a fully equipped, reconfigurable, teaching and learning space developed by European Schoolnet, its 30 supporting Ministries of Education and leading educational technology providers.

item.title: Digital Library of Bibliographic Heritage, Spain
item.description: As part of HISPANA, the Digital Library of Bibliographic Heritage has chosen to use the Europeana API to complement results in their own search services with relevant links from Europeana.

item.title: Digital Humanities Observatory
item.description: The Digital Humanities Observatory has extended its API implementation to harvest the Irish related Europeana 1914-1918 stories relating to Ireland, making them available on their portal and displaying them in their experimental ‘Exhibit Visualizations’.

item.title: CH Context widget
item.description: This JavaScript-based widget is able to provide links to cultural heritage materials (from Europeana or Digital Public Library of America or Polish Digital Library Federation) based on predefined item of a website on which it is embedded (via given JQuery HTML selector).

item.title: CERL Thesaurus Search
item.description: Through the Europeana API, users can now see the number of results in Europeana related to the authority and click through to view them.

item.title: CARARE Map
item.description: CARARE Map is a web-based mapping tool for archaeological/architectural sites.

item.title: Biblioteca Virtual Ignacio Larramendi
item.description: This API complements search results within the digital library of the Larramendi Foundation with results from Europeana.

item.title: Platoniq | Palma
item.description: Since 2001 we at Platoniq have collaborated and worked with lots of cultural and social collectives, nationally and internationally, in the area of ICT development, to promote free and open culture and citizen’s participation. We cooperate with public institutions, universities and companies with affinity for the collaborative economy’s philosophy and the principles of free knowledge.

item.title: Popes on artwork, drawings and documents from the Rijksmuseum in the Netherlands
Photographs, Prints and Posters from the Biblioteca Valenciana Digital
Natural History Art from the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam (Netherlands)
Napoleon on artwork, drawings and documents from the Amsterdam Museum
Maps and Drawings from the Catálogo Colectivo De La Red De Bibliotecas De Los Archivos Estatales
Maps and Drawings from the Biblioteca Virtual Del Patrimonio Bibliográfico
Early Photographs from the Fondo Fotográfico De La Universidad De Navarra
Butterflies, moths, plants and mushrooms from the University of Tartu
Beetles from the Royal Belgian Institute of Natural Sciences
Battles on artwork and drawings from the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam
